title: Missing man Malcolm Walker seen assaulted and forced into car
text:
Police are searching for a man who may have been assaulted and forced into a vehicle in Adelaide’s northern suburbs on Sunday evening.

Malcolm Walker, 25, was declared missing in the hours after police received reports of the abduction at 6.30pm.

Police were told that a man matching Mr Walker’s description was bundled into a car at Elizabeth Downs after being assaulted.

media_camera Malcolm Walker has been missing since Sunday evening and is believed to have been abducted. Picture: South Australian Police

He has not been heard from since.

Northern District Criminal Investigation Branch detectives are investigating the incident and do not believe that it was random.

They are urging Mr Walker to make contact with them or his family.

Mr Walker is described as caucasian, 184cm tall, slim build, with brown hair and brown eyes. He has tattoos on both sides of his neck.

Anyone who has seen Mr Walker or has information on his whereabouts is urged to contact the Police Assistance Line on 131 444 immediately
description: A missing man was last seen being assaulted and then forced into a car, police believe. Detectives are now investigating his disappearance and urging anyone with information to come forward.
